title: Divinity Road
text:
Divinity Road is a residential road in <a href="Oxford">Oxford</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. It connects with the east end of <a href="Morrell%20Avenue">Morrell Avenue</a> to the northeast and with <a href="Cowley%20Road%2C%20Oxford">Cowley Road</a> to the southwest. The road is on a <a href="Headington%20Hill">hill</a> sloping southwest.
The road includes detached, semi-detached, and terraced houses. 
Divinity Road Area Residents’ Association (DRARA) is a <a href="residents%27%20association">residents' association</a> in the local area around Divinity Road.
The Beeches, student accommodation of <a href="Linacre%20College%2C%20Oxford">Linacre College, Oxford</a>, is located in Divinity Road.
<a href="Lily%20van%20den%20Broecke">Lily van den Broecke</a>, a gold medalist in the <a href="Rowing%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Mixed%20coxed%20four">mixed coxed fours event</a> on <a href="Dorney%20Lake">Dorney Lake</a> at the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Paralympic%20Games">2012 Summer Paralympic Games</a>, was a resident of the road in 2012, so a <a href="post%20box">post box</a> in the road was painted gold in her honour.
Divinity Road features in the book "The Rocktastic Corduroy Peach" by Michael Amos.
